data.scheme_name: Animal husbandry infrastructure development fund (AHIDF) - Quantum of loan and margin money - Micro & Small - New
data.benefits: Scheme provides a loan up to 90% of the project cost, with a 10% promoter's contribution.
data.eligibility: Eligible activities under the scheme include dairy processing, meat processing, animal feed manufacturing, breed improvement, veterinary vaccine/drug production, animal waste management, and primary wool processing
data.conditions: Loan excludes land acquisition; land must be owned or leased (min. 10 years) with required approvals and clearances.
data.beneficiaries: Eligible activities include dairy processing, meat processing, animal feed manufacturing, breed improvement, veterinary vaccine/drug production, animal waste management, and primary wool processing.
data.prerequisites: Loans will not be provided for land acquisition through purchase, transfer, lease, accession, or addition. Projects with land on a long-term lease (minimum 10 years) may be considered, provided the lease is sufficient to secure the loan, and a No Objection Certificate for mortgage may be required.
data.nodal_agency: Animal Husbandry and Dairying, Ministry of Fisheries, Government of India
data.context: AHIDF promotes investments in the animal husbandry sector by developing infrastructure in dairy and meat processing, animal feed manufacturing, breed improvement, veterinary vaccine production, and animal waste management.
data.objective: The key objectives of the Animal Husbandry Infrastructure Development Fund (AHIDF) are: Increase milk and meat processing capacity and product diversification.Enhance price realization for producers.Ensure quality milk and meat products for domestic consumers.Address growing protein requirements, foster entrepreneurship, generate employment, promote exports, and ensure the availability of affordable, quality animal feed.
data.description: The scheme provides a loan up to 90% of the estimated or actual project cost, with a beneficiary contribution of up to 10%.
data.funding_facilitator: a. Scheduled Bank(s)b. National Cooperative Development Corporation (NCDC)c. National Bank for Agriculture and Rural Development (NABARD)d. National Dairy Development Board (NDDB)
data.funding_mechanism: The benefit will be released on approval of application by the concerned authority.
data.additional_info: Cost escalation due to valid reasons like natural calamities or technical issues may be considered for loan enhancement within two years. Interest subvention doesnâ€™t apply to loans for land, working capital, pre-operative expenses, IDC, or personal-use assets.
data.beneficiary: Specific Industry - All Entities - All locations - Micro and Small
data.lifecycle: Required Credit Support for Scale - Up
